Tit. 9 ยง 8.115 - Executive Order No. 115: Extending the Period for Paying Property Taxes in Certain School Districts Within the Counties of Broome, Chenango, Clinton, Delaware, Essex, Franklin, Herkimer, Madison, Montgomery, Niagara, Oneida, Otsego, Schoharie, St. Lawrence, Tioga and Warren
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.115 - Executive Order No. 115: Extending the Period for Paying Property Taxes in Certain School Districts Within the Counties of Broome, Chenango, Clinton, Delaware, Essex, Franklin, Herkimer, Madison, Montgomery, Niagara, Oneida, Otsego, Schoharie, St. Lawrence, Tioga and Warren

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on June 27, 2013 and continuing thereafter, severe
storms and flooding disrupted public transportation and utility service, and
threatened public health and safety systems within the Counties of Broome, Chenango, Clinton, Delaware, Essex, Franklin, Herkimer, Madison, Montgomery, Oneida, Otsego, Schoharie, St. Lawrence, Tioga and Warren (collectively, the
"June 27th Flooding Impacted Counties") and the County of Niagara (together
with the June 27th Flooding Impacted Counties, the "Flooding Impacted

Counties"); and
WHEREAS, on June 28, 2013 I issued Executive Order Number
103 declaring a disaster emergency in the June 27th Flooding Impacted Counties; and
WHEREAS, on July 15, 2013 I issued Executive Order Number
108 declaring a disaster emergency in the County of Niagara; and
WHEREAS, property taxes for the 2013 school district year
for the Flooding Impacted Counties will be soon due (such date, the "Applicable

Property Tax Due Date"); and
WHEREAS, this event, which has caused flooding, damaged
public and private property, including homes, apartments and businesses, damaged and downed trees and washed out roadways, will continue to pose a
threat to public health and safety and, therefore, make it exceedingly
difficult for families to pay their property taxes by the Applicable Property

Tax Due Date; and
WHEREAS, Section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law authorizes the Governor to retroactively extend
the period for paying such taxes without interest or penalty upon request of
the chief executive officer of an affected county, city, town, village or
school district during a State disaster emergency by up to twenty-one days from
the final date such taxes are currently due; and
WHEREAS, a request for such an extension has been received
by the Governor's Office on behalf of the following school districts within the

Flooding Impacted Counties: Clinton County - AuSable Valley Central School

District; Essex County - Elizabethtown-Lewis Central School District and Moriah

Central School District; Montgomery County - Fort Plain Central School

District; and
WHEREAS, given the difficulties continuing to confront the
people of the Flooding Impacted Counties, such an extension is eminently
warranted; NOW, THEREFORE, I, ANDREW M. CUOMO, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by Section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby retroactively extend the period for
paying without interest or penalty the property taxes that are due on or about
the Applicable Property Tax Due Date in the Flooding Impacted Counties for
twenty-one days from the final date such taxes are currently due. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: October 7, 2013
